alert.note: Alert for West Central Highlands; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 3:47PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL CIBOLA AND CENTRAL MCKINLEY COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM MDT... At 347 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Milan, or 8 miles west of Grants, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Grants, Milan, Bluewater Lake State Park, Bluewater Lake, Prewitt and San Rafael in Cibola County. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 60 and 88. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: West Central Highlands; West Central Mountains
